title: Island Perimeter with Bridges
description: You are given a representation of an island as a grid where '1' represents land and '0' represents water.  An island may have bridges connecting different landmasses. A bridge is defined as a horizontal or vertical path of '1's connecting two or more separate landmasses.  Write a function that calculates the total perimeter of the island, *including the perimeter of the bridges themselves*.  Note that a bridge adds to the total perimeter, not just the perimeter of the individual landmasses it connects.

examples.explanation: The island has a perimeter of 12. The two landmasses are connected by a bridge, adding to the total perimeter.
There are four separate landmasses each with a perimeter of 4, thus a total perimeter of 12. (no bridges)

Even with the interior '0', the outer perimeter is counted.


Constraints:
- The grid will be rectangular.
- The grid will only contain '0's and '1's.
- The dimensions of the grid will be at most 100x100.
- You can assume that there is at least one landmass (one or more '1's) in the grid.
- Time complexity should be O(m*n) where m and n are the dimensions of the grid.
- Space complexity should be O(1) (in-place or constant extra space).
